Authors: Takashi Shirouzu, Yu Fukasawa, Yasuhide Nakamura
Title:
Femsjonia uniseptata (Dacrymycetes, Basidiomycota), a new
species collected from Pinus densiflora forests in Japan.
Abstract:
Fruiting bodies of an undescribed dacrymycetous species
were collected from Pinus densiflora forests in Japan. This new species,
Femsjonia uniseptata, is characterized by the presence of discoid to
applanate basidiocarps having white hairs at the margins, thin-walled
internal and marginal hyphae with clamp connections, and 01-septate
basidiospores. According to a molecular phylogenetic analysis, F.
uniseptata is closely related to a specimen identified as F.
peziziformis. Within Femsjonia, F. uniseptata is morphologically most
similar to F. pezizoidea; however, the latter species has turbinate or
obconic basidiocarps, thick-walled internal and marginal hyphae, and
3-septate basidiospores. The new species is also similar to Dacrymyces
corticioides, but the latter has 13-septate basidiospores. With the
addition of F. uniseptata, the genus Femsjonia now comprises seven
species.
